description: With Super Contacts, which was listed at the top of the 10 must have WebOS applications by PCWorld, you have the ability to group contacts, quickly dial, SMS or email individual contacts, and the power to broadcast an email or SMS to the group or subset of the group. Contacts can be globally searched by group name for use in other applications. The Quick Tap functionality allows you to rapidly cycle through and initiate a call, email or SMS using a configurable list of phone numbers, SMS numbers and email addresses for a contact. Contact information is automatically populated using the contact information on your phone. Flicking the contact left or right gives you additional options for contacting that contact. The group tab names, colors and order are customizable. The contact list on a tab can be rapidly filtered by tapping the letter associated with the editable display name. For more information, check out the video and other information at the Developer Home (www.orgorganization.com).__v1.0.1: Added the ability for contacts to be moved into a specific order,Added a launcher for launching the Contacts, Phone, Messaging and Email apps. __v1.0.2:Integrated group names into global search,Improved flick responsiveness,Improved image clarity when possible,Added the ability to have email recipients sent to TO,CC and BCC,Names can be conditionally hidden now,Added the ability to quickly cancel contact. __v1.0.3:Added batching of SMS messages to get around the 20 recipient limitation,Added the ability to copy the list of email addresses for an entire group.__v1.0.4:improved automatic picture selection. __v1.0.5:Adjustable SMS batch sizes to accommodate various carrier restrictions,Troubleshooting Mode and automated problem reporting__v1.0.8: fixed 2nd use grey screen issue some users were seeing,fixed an issue that kept some images from transferring to SC.__v1.1.0:Improved batch sms interface
versionNote: Now works with WebOs versions 1 and 2.  Also, the advertisements have been removed.
